result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip L. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSECUTIVE to 14CF14 and concurrent to 11CF1017
**AMENDED TO READ - CONSECUTIVE TO 04CF714 NOT 14CF14**

superMiscConds.notes: **DOC to determine restitution for remaining victims**

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.     
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $4572.62 plus surcharges.  
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges for remaining victims; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  
May not have contact with victims or places of business, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim from Clay's Tap present and addressed.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP consecutive to 14CF714 and concurrent to 11CF1017; 3 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is elgible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; on ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP consecutive to 14CF714 and concurrent to ct 1 and to 11CF1017; 3 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is elgible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; on ct 8 the court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP consecutive to 14CF714 and concurrent to cts 1 & 4 and with 11CF1017; 3 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is elgible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; on ct 10 the court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP consecutive to 14CF714 and concurrent to cts 1, 4 & 8 and with 11CF1017; 3 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is elgible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $1,000 DNA surcharge; deft to pay restitution in the amount of $4,572.62 (by stipulation of deft); restitution to be determined for remianing victims.  (NOTE:  4/28/15 the sentences are consecutive to 04CF714, not 14CF714. hb)
Restitution in the amount of $4572.62.  Restitution to be determined for remaining victims.
